body:
Hey, Im here to introduce my Public Scrimmage Server, it has old OCN maps and in the future some Avicus maps (will try to get permissions). This server was created to keep a fraction of the Overcast community. I know Avicus is a 1.8 server, but since there are some OCN players here I need some advertisement to make this work. This is not a network.


                                                                                      s3.hosthorde.com:26330

  Cycle

You can ask for the cycle rank if you are the leader/co-leader of a team and you want to play here. Remember that there are rules, do not abuse it or it will be removed.
Form

  Rules

You can see the rules typing /rules on the server!
Optifine, Togglesprint and Labymod are allowed. If you think someone is cheating you can use /report. This server has a dedicated staff that is almost always online. 
Note: Screenshares will take place if a person recieves too many reports or if he is suspicious.


 Mod Applications coming soon! 
You can join to our Discord to be in touch!


Remember that I do not earn money doing this. 1.9 version.

title: Public Scrimmage Server 1.9 (OCN)

replies.body_tagged: Cuales son las reglas como cualquier otro sv ?)

replies.body: Se implementara un comando en servidor ( /rules ) en donde se podrán ver las reglas y lo que es baneable, kickeable o warneable.

replies.body:
Buena suerte con tu servidor, de vez en cuando entraré a jugar unas scrimmages! Por cierto, si necesitas algunos mapas de Avicus aquí puedes encontrar varios mapas que son públicos, no son muchos pero son algo. (solo necesitas hacer un XML compatible para la versión de PGM/Cardinal que estas usando): Map Stack.

Si necesitas ayuda con algo solo dime.

replies.body:
Wait this server was created after Avicus was created? So technically (Stratus and the scrimmage server) copied Avicus!!!111

Dankest timeline?

since it's obvious I can't function on less than 3 hours of sleep I'll get real:


Seriously though, this sounds super cool. I'm happy to see that the community wasn't killed by lifeboat

replies.body_tagged: Oe pawer los mapas d avicus también los van a poner 1.9? :^)

replies.body:
Neat!

Just so you're aware though (I wasn't sure if you were), Avicus maps and OCN maps don't use the exact same type of XML. If you want to be using Avicus maps (which I think would be really cool), you'd have to redo the XML so it's compatible with Cardinal/PGM.

replies.body:
Alright, cool.

And I think someone else might have linked this on the thread somewhere, but MapStack is a great resource for getting maps (and it has an Avicus section too!). We have bunch of maps currently, and hoping to get more. https://mcresourcepile.github.io/mapstack/avicus
